*﻿﻿‌&#8205;&#8205;&#8206;&#x200B;​‌&#8206;⁠&#8288;&#8204;⁠&#8205;﻿﻿⁠&#8288;⁠&#8204;⁠&#8204;﻿‍&#8288;&#8204;‍&#8288;&#8288;⁠&#8206;﻿&#8206;‎&#8203;⁠‍&#8206;&#8205;⁠&#8204;&#8288;*⁠&#8205;﻿&#8204;⁠‎﻿&#8288;&#x200B;&#8288;&#8204;&#x200B;‍⁠&#x200B;&#8205;⁠&#8203;‌&#8205;⁠‍&#8204;&#8206;​﻿&#8206;&#8203;‍​&#8205;‌E⁠&#8203;⁠‌​&#8206;‍&#8205;&#8204;&#8206;&#8204;‎﻿‌&#x200B;&#8204;&#x200B;&#x200B;&#8206;﻿&#8205;&#8205;&#8206;x﻿‍&#8288;⁠&#8288;&#8204;⁠&#8206;​&#8206;‎﻿‍&#8205;‍‎⁠⁠&#8204;&#x200B;‍&#8205;&#8203;&#x200B;&#8204;&#8205;‌&#8288;&#x200B;&#8205;‌h&#8205;​&#8204;⁠​&#8205;&#8206;&#8203;&#8203;&#8206;‌&#x200B;&#8203;&#8203;&#x200B;​‍⁠&#8204;&#8203;&#8206;&#8203;&#8205;‌i&#8205;&#8288;‎⁠&#x200B;&#8206;&#8205;&#8288;⁠‎&#8206;&#x200B;⁠&#8205;‍&#8206;&#8205;&#x200B;&#8204;&#x200B;‌&#8203;﻿&#8203;‍&#x200B;&#8288;&#8288;​&#x200B;&#8204;&#8204;‌‍&#8205;&#8205;‎⁠b&#x200B;‌&#x200B;&#x200B;&#8203;&#8205;&#8206;‎​‌&#8288;&#8203;‌&#8204;&#8288;&#8205;&#8203;‎&#8206;&#8203;‎⁠⁠i‎&#x200B;​‍&#8204;&#8203;﻿‎​&#8203;‍&#x200B;⁠&#8205;‎‎&#8288;﻿‌&#x200B;&#8206;&#8205;‎&#8205;​​&#x200B;&#8203;&#8204;&#8206;&#8288;‍​&#8288;&#8203;&#8205;‍t‍&#8203;&#8288;‍&#8205;‍⁠&#8206;&#8288;&#8204;﻿‌&#8288;⁠⁠﻿‍⁠&#8203;&#x200B;&#8206;‍​‌ 1‎‍&#8204;‍‍&#8205;‌&#8288;‎﻿‌&#8203;&#8206;&#8204;&#8206;‌&#8203;‎&#8204;‌⁠​&#x200B;‎&#8205;​‎&#x200B;‎​&#8204;&#8204;&#8205;1&#8288;&#8203;&#8205;&#8288;​&#8206;&#8288;‌&#8205;&#8288;​﻿‌‍&#8204;&#8203;⁠‌&#8204;⁠​1&#8203;&#8203;﻿&#8203;&#8203;​&#8288;&#8203;&#8204;&#8206;‍​&#8204;‌&#8203;&#8206;⁠&#8203;﻿&#x200B;‌⁠‎&#8206;​&#8203;‎‎‌﻿*‎‍​&#8288;‍&#8206;&#8205;⁠&#8203;﻿⁠&#x200B;&#x200B;​﻿​⁠&#8206;​⁠‌‌​‌&#8205;&#8288;&#8288;&#8205;‎​&#x200B;&#8205;​‎&#8203;&#8205;&#8288;​&#8203;⁠&#8205;⁠‎​⁠&#x200B;&#x200B;&#8288;*​&#8204;&#x200B;&#8288;&#x200B;&#x200B;&#8203;&#8288;⁠‎&#8204;&#8288;⁠‍&#8206;&#8204;&#8204;‎﻿&#8288;&#8203;&#x200B;‎&#8203;‍&#8204;﻿﻿‌&#8203;&#8206;&#8288;‍⁠&#8206;‍&#x200B;‎&#x200B;‍&#8203;‍&#8204;&#8206;‍﻿

Randy/Justin -
Thanks for reviewing the attached. As you can imagine, this is a very sensitive matter, as it ultimately impacts the composition of the board of directors of Shift4 (and its subsidiaries).

Currently, Shift4's board consists of:
 1.  Myself;
 2.  My wife (Kathy); and
 3. Sam Massih (pursuant to a nominee director agreement that we offered, I'm happy to share this if necessary). And before you ask, this was something that was in place well before our current situation. It was a condition of his investment.

As you are aware, Shift4 is in the process of defending a number of lawsuits, The Rocket matter litigation may be the most concerning to you at this time. The judge recently ruled against my motion for stay pending arbitration. As I'm sure Justin mentioned (or will mention) the potential liability here is significant.

To that end, I think we need to get creative. If CardConnect were willing to immediately appoint a director to Shift4's board, you can call a board meeting and take a vote. With Sam's vote, that's a majority... In exchange, we can either (a) offer repayment terms and security; or (b) exchange releases. I am indifferent.

The question here is ultimately one of timing. I'm happy to get creative, but need this done ASAP.

J.Ďavid

Randy/Justin -
Thanks for reviewing the attached. As you can imagine, this is a very sensitive matter, as it ultimately impacts the composition of the board of directors of Shift4 (and its subsidiaries).

Currently, Shift4's board consists of:
 1.  Myself;
 2.  My wife (Kathy); and
 3. Sam Massih (pursuant to a nominee director agreement that we offered, I'm happy to share this if necessary). And before you ask, this was something that was in place well before our current situation. It was a condition of his investment.

As you are aware, Shift4 is in the process of defending a number of lawsuits, The Rocket matter litigation may be the most concerning to you at this time. The judge recently ruled against my motion for stay pending arbitration. As I'm sure Justin mentioned (or will mention) the potential liability here is significant.

To that end, I think we need to get creative. If CardConnect were willing to immediately appoint a director to Shift4's board, you can call a board meeting and take a vote. With Sam's vote, that's a majority... In exchange, we can either (a) offer repayment terms and security; or (b) exchange releases. I am indifferent.

The question here is ultimately one of timing. I'm happy to get creative, but need this done ASAP.

J.Ďavid

Randy/Justin -
Thanks for reviewing the attached. As you can imagine, this is a very sensitive matter, as it ultimately impacts the composition of the board of directors of Shift4 (and its subsidiaries).

Currently, Shift4's board consists of:
 1.  Myself;
 2.  My wife (Kathy); and
 3. Sam Massih (pursuant to a nominee director agreement that we offered, I'm happy to share this if necessary). And before you ask, this was something that was in place well before our current situation. It was a condition of his investment.

As you are aware, Shift4 is in the process of defending a number of lawsuits, The Rocket matter litigation may be the most concerning to you at this time. The judge recently ruled against my motion for stay pending arbitration. As I'm sure Justin mentioned (or will mention) the potential liability here is significant.

To that end, I think we need to get creative. If CardConnect were willing to immediately appoint a director to Shift4's board, you can call a board meeting and take a vote. With Sam's vote, that's a majority... In exchange, we can either (a) offer repayment terms and security; or (b) exchange releases. I am indifferent.

The question here is ultimately one of timing. I'm happy to get creative, but need this done ASAP.

J.Ďavid
